name: 4,4-bis(dimethylamino)benzophenone
Reason: 4,4-Bis(dimethylamino)benzophenone has a melting point that we will analyze by considering its structural components. Starting with the basic unit of benzene, which has a melting point of 5.5°C. The presence of two phenyl groups in this compound increases the melting point due to their ability to enhance π-π interactions and overall molecular rigidity. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50°C. Additionally, the two dimethylamino groups can participate in hydrogen bonding, which may raise the melting point by approximately +10°C each. The ketone group introduces polar carbonyl interactions, contributing approximately +40°C. The methyl groups can participate in hydrogen bonding, contributing approximately +5°C each.
